result.execSummary:
The defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay the related surcharge.
Pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments, DNA surcharge  AND restitution. To be collected by DOC from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain employment.  Obtain GED or HSED.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Stacy L.
No alcohol or illegal drugs.
No prescription medications without a valid prescription.

Cooperate with agent.
Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
Follow all rules of Extended supervision.
Pay all supervision fees.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keyjuan Lavell Henry

defendant.name: Henry, Keyjuan Lavell
defendant.address: 2517 W Capitol Dr. Apt 2, Milwaukee, WI 53206

records.addlTxt: SENTENCING HEARING Transcript commencing 10-26-2016 received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 16CF001540 (24 Pages). CH

Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEARS, concurrent with 15CF540.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $1,835.00 payable to Stacy L., to be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or percentage which the department determines is reasonable for restitution to victims; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected by DOC from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment 
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain employment  
-Obtain GED or HSED
-No contact with Stacy L. 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or illegal drugs 
-No prescription medications without a valid prescription  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties may have reached a resolution.  Matter set for a "soft" plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's other pending felony matter has been scheduled for a SPEED JURY TRIAL.  This matter to follow as a status.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 10:00 am.

State does not contest the findings of Dr. Engen.  Colloquy conducted with Defendant regarding the findings of Dr. Engen.  Defendant does not contest the findings of Dr. Engen.   Court reinstates proceedings.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense raises competency pursuant to Wisc. Stat. 971.14(3).  Court suspends proceedings and ordered defendant be examined by the Forensic Unit.   Defendant remanded into the custody of the Sheriff's Department.   Matter adjourned for Return on Doctor's Report.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date. Case remains calendared in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry in court with Claire Zyber, student intern under the supervision of attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Cimpl Branch 19.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Keyjuan Lavell Henry in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Cimpl, Branch 19.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
